subject: Personal Finance
title: The Savings and Loan Crisis
description: Learn The Savings and Loan Crisis in one minute.

hook.text: In the 1980s, over 1,000 US savings institutions failed. Taxpayers paid $132 billion for the cleanup.

buildup.text: Savings and loans were small banks that took deposits and made home mortgages. Simple and stable.

discovery.text: Deregulation in the 1980s let them make risky bets with insured deposits. Many gambled recklessly.

twist.text: Deposits were federally insured. Executives took huge risks knowing taxpayers would cover the losses.

climax.text: The S&L crisis was a dress rehearsal for 2008 â€” same pattern of deregulation, moral hazard, and bailout.

punchline.text: Insured risk-taking is a recipe for disaster.

quiz.question: What caused the Savings and Loan crisis?
options: Deregulation allowed risky bets with insured deposits
